etymology.description: semantic: 行 ‘street’ + 止 ‘foot’ + phonetic: 𩠐; later the semantic parts merged as 辵 in seal script.
etymology.interpretation: Street and foot evoke movement along a path, while 𩠐 supplied the sound. Over time the walking elements fused into the 辶 radical, leaving a right-side component derived from the phonetic in the modern form.

parts.english: to go; to do; row; line

examples.chinese: 这条道路很窄(這條道路很窄)。
她懂得做人之道(她懂得做人之道)。
examples.english: She understands the way of conducting oneself.

examples.chinese: 他轻声说道(他輕聲說道)。
